item.title: Uninstall CANu
item.description: Uninstall CANU Uninstalling CANU can be achieved by: linux# pip3 uninstall canu

item.title: Update CANu From Release Tarball
item.description: Update CANU From CSM Release Tarball If doing a CSM install or upgrade, the release tarball contains a CANU RPM. It can be extracted and installed using the following steps. Procedure Display the current CANU version. ncn# canu --version Set the TARBALL variable to the path and filename of the CSM release tarball: ncn# TARBALL=/your/path/here/csm-version.tar.gz Extract the CANU RPM from the tarball: ncn# tar -xzvf "$TARBALL" --wildcards "*/canu*.

item.title: Use CANu To Generate Full Network Configuration
item.description: Use CANU to Generate Full Network Configuration CANU can also generate switch configurations for all the switches on a network. In order to generate network configurations, a valid SHCD must be passed in and system variables must be read in from either CSI output or the SLS API. The instructions are exactly the same as the above except there will not be a hostname and a folder must be specified for configuration output using the --folder FOLDERNAME flag.

item.title: Initializing CANu
item.description: Initializing CANU Initialize the CSM Automatic Network Utility (CANU) in order to help create the switch configurations. CANU can automatically parse CSI output or the Shasta System Layout Service (SLS) API for switch IPv4 addresses. Using the SLS API is only possible after the CSM install has been completed at least to the point where CSM Services have been deployed. Prior to that, parsing CSI output is the only option.

item.title: Introduction To CANu
item.description: Introduction to CANU The CSM Automatic Network Utility (CANU) guides administrators through the installation of new Shasta networks. CANU helps ensure that the installation follows best practices and helps administrators set up a supported configuration. The following are some of the tasks that CANU can perform: Check if the management switches on a Shasta network meet the firmware version requirements Check the cabling status of the management switches on a Shasta network using LLDP.

item.title: Quick Start Guide To CANu
item.description: Quick start guide to CANU Usage To run, type canu. It should run and display help. To see a list of commands and arguments, just append --help. When running CANU, the Shasta version is required, you can pass it in with either -s or --shasta for example: ncn# canu -s 1.5 To checkout a fresh system using CSI: Make a new directory to save switch IP addresses: ncn# mkdir ips_folder ncn# cd ips_folder Parse CSI files and save switch IP addresses: ncn# canu -s 1.

item.title: CANu Installation
item.description: CANU Installation Prerequisites In order to run CANU, both python3 and pip3 must be installed. Installation Install pip3, if it is not already installed. linux# pip3 install --editable Install the development build of CANU. linux# python3 setup.py develop --user Back to Index
